rig 𓌗

𓌗 rig ⇔ Reuse 𓍯
𓌗 rig ⇔ 𐎗𐎋𐎒 rks рачел račel 'belt'

𒋆𒋢 rik-su rigging PIE *reyg- “to bind”
𒋆𒋢 binding, bond, knot

𒊏𒅗𒋢 ra-ka-su rik𐍃 Germanic *rik- “to bind” PIE *rign-, *reyg- “to bind”
𒊏𒅗𒋢 to bind
⇔
𒊏𒅗𒁍 ra-ka-bu rück-up riggaᵇ (“to rig a horse”)
𒊏𒅗𒁍 ra-ka-bu √ר־כ־ב r-c-b
𒊏𒅗𒁍 𐎗𐎋𐎁 rkb, “to ride, to mount” rückup
𒊏𒅗𒁍 mount, to ride ⋍ reçe
⇔
𒊏𒆠𒁍 ra-ki-bu Recke (warrior)
𒊏𒆠𒁍 rider ☑

𒌑𒊩𒆧 úrakkis bind

rig ⇔ ride rigga (“to rig a horse”) rüsten@Ross hoss horse ⇔ right ⇔ Reck reçeᵇ ⇔ ridge
√ר־כ־ב r-c-b 𐎗𐎋𐎁 rkb, “to ride, to mount” rückup
